intro: Fimbristylis aestivalis var. trichopoda, commonly known as the hairy flat sedge, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is a member of the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and related grass-like plants. The plant typically grows in wetland environments, such as marshes and along the edges of ponds. Its leaves are linear and often covered with fine hairs, contributing to its common name. The inflorescence consists of a dense cluster of small, three-lobed flowers that are usually greenish or brownish in color.
